page.title: 01The Grand Union Canal,Ashby
page.content: This canal passes close by Ashby on a transport route also followed by the A5,the M1,and the London-Birmingham railway In 1929 the new Grand Union Company was formed by the merger of the Grand Junction Canal,Regents Canal,and three canals of Birmingham.The length of this new company line was 255 miles. The Grand Union Canal at Watford has seven locks,four of which are in a staircase.The Watford locks were widened for the larger steam barges or carriers,like Fellows, Morton and Clayton in 1901-1902 at a cost of 100,000 pounds. The canal traffic used to consist of barges carrying coal and heavy agricultural produce,but now it is mainly holiday narrow-boats and cabin cruisers.
